column4: im running ubuntu netbook version 10.04 and when i start up my bluetooth applet does not start. How do I get it to start up?
there's a switch to make it always display or only when connected, are you wanting that?
im wanting it to always display
okay, the way I would do it is different than the sane way
sane way is System > Preferences > Bluetooth [x] Show Bluetooth icon
insane way is install 'dconf-tools' and run dconf-editor to edit the GSettings value manually
ok...i dont really know if my laptop is supporting bluetooth honestly. it tells me no adapters but when i had windows on this thing it had bluetooth
it is telling me i have no adapters installed but when i had windows i had bluetooth on my laptop?
too bad about that
I only know how to tell the bluetooth applet software to be there when a supported bluetooth device is there
ah ok..thanks tho
the output of 'hcitool dev' can show you any supported hci (bluetooth)
you need to make it so that your bluetooth is working before the software can interact
ok
so if it comes up blank my guess is its not supported
correct !
ok thanks...i was hoping that it had bluetooth wanted to play around with that
some laptops disable wifi to enable bluetooth, or they are switched on and off together
try your switches on your laptop's surface
its a netbook and has no switches
you can make a switch with a sharp bowie knife, and repeated stabbing motions? >:-)
lol this is true
maybe you can help me...im taking a networking class in school and looking for cool and useful networking programs for ubuntu...any you know of?
